boardgame.name: Handelsfürsten: Herren der Meere
Maritime Silk Road
Merchants
交易王
海上丝路
boardgame.description: description from pegasus.de :_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The 16th century marks the beginning of a new age. America is discovered, the spice route to India is established and the exchange of goods in Europe becomes more and more easy. Huge merchant ships are at home on the sea._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players take the role of the Fuggers, Welsers, Voehlins or Hoechstetters (all powerful families at that time) and try to maximize their income through clever trade with goods and use of their wares-cards. To win the game, you need to benefit from competitors' actions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;From Catalyst Game Labs:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The 16th and 17th Centuries open a new era in trade. The Americas are newly colonized, and large merchant-vessels ply the sea lanes, bringing resources back to a desperate England. Lead one of four emerging families destined to control this swelling market. Be bold, realize the biggest profit!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Every player starts with three Good Cards, two Ship Cards and one Goods Token on each ship corresponding to one of the six Goods Cards in the game: Indigo, Fur, Corn, Lumber, Fish and Cotton. Every turn a player may draw or play various cards. This can change Goods Tokens on player's Ship Cards, the face-up Goods Cards on the playing area, trigger scoring, and so on._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implementation of:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Ferkelei, with a number of changes (there are things to buy other than more cubes, and the scoring works differently)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2008 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; Selection Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Besprechung von Krallen und Fallen sowie Handelsfürsten-Herren der Meere

listing.notes: BRANDNEW: Still shrinkwrapped copy of this brilliant new Knizia! All games come from a private collection (non-smoking environment)! Please contact me if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re looking for more interesting German games as I can offer a lot more. Buyer pays postage, so ask before buying to determine the weight of your desired games! The following payments are welcome: (1) Cash in a registered letter (only Euro accepted) or (2) Chargefree(!) EU Bank-Transfer (using IBAN and SWIFT) or (3) Moneybookers.com (it´s as fast and safe as PayPal but much cheaper: maximum fee is 0.50 EUR) or (4) PayPal (for PayPal payment please add +5 % of the total sum). Have fun playing, Flix! --------------------------------------------- NEW SHIPPING CONDITIONS TO US! PLEASE READ!! --------------------------------------------- I can now send parcels to the US through a friend of mine who is US Army member in Germany. + Cheaper shipping (13,90 EURO for Priority Mail) + including insurance + Much faster delivery (USPS Airmail) = More satisfaction Regular SHIPPING with DHL (=German Post): -------------------------------------------------------- _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; up to 1000 g without insurance (e.g. small cardgames): Europe: EUR 8,00 US/Canada: EUR 13,90 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; up to 2000 g without insurance: Germany: EUR 4,30 EU: EUR 10,00 US/Canada/Rest of Europe: EUR 15,00 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; up to 5 kg with tracking _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; limited insurance Germany: EUR 7,00 Europe: EUR 19,00 - 32,00 (depending on country) US/Canada: EUR 34,00

Complete and in excellent condition.

I ship everything via USPS Priority Mail flat rate boxes - with _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Fragile,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Keep Dry,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Do Not Bend_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; written on the boxes. The rate structure for those boxes is as follows: Shipping for games that will fit within a 8.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 5.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 1.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box costs $4.95. Shipping for games that will fit within a 13.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 11.75_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 3.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box costs $10.70. I can easily combine shipping if games will fit within these boxes. If they don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t, I can still combine shipping, but that is a little tricker. Thursdays are the days I get most of my shipping done, if that helps you.
Never played.
Handelsfürsten: Herren der Meere Pegasus First Edition. language independent, rules available here on the Geek in english still in shrink

Catalyst Game Labs (CYT 11040) Originally published as Handelsfürsten by Pegasus Spiele in Germany, Merchants focused on a theme of Old World trading in the 16th century. While the over-all theme of tall-ship trading remains unchanged, all new art has been generated, focusing the items traded towards an American market. The game play remains unchanged from its original German publication and Reiner Knizia design. A classic German-style resource management style of play, with rules that are read and understood in minutes, but a depth of play that allows for a lot of fun repeat play.
First german edition - with signature from Reiner Knizia!
In shrink German Shipping Germany 3 Euro Shipping European Union 4 Euro Shipping World 4 Euro PayPal plus 1 Euro Money transfer via IBAN/BIC preferred
German first edition. It has only been played once or twice, and the components are in very good condition. The box has two split corners. A printout of the English rules is included.
All cards etc in shrink. Nick: German first edition Publisher: Pegasus Spiele
Reserved for Barry(Futza)
Reserved for Scott Adams
